append-field

A W3C HTML JSON forms spec compliant field appender (for lack of a better name). Useful for people implementing application/x-www-form-urlencoded and multipart/form-data parsers.

It works best on objects created with Object.create(null). Otherwise it might conflict with variables from the prototype (e.g. hasOwnProperty).

Installation

sh npm install --save append-field

Usage

```javascript var appendField = require('append-field') var obj = Object.create(null)

appendField(obj, 'pets[0][species]', 'Dahut') appendField(obj, 'pets[0][name]', 'Hypatia') appendField(obj, 'pets[1][species]', 'Felis Stultus') appendField(obj, 'pets[1][name]', 'Billie')

console.log(obj) ```

text { pets: [ { species: 'Dahut', name: 'Hypatia' }, { species: 'Felis Stultus', name: 'Billie' } ] }

API

appendField(store, key, value)

Adds the field named key with the value value to the object store.

License
